repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
A multi-text manuscript, entitled Vētāntam 2 on its additional title page, containing two Vedānta works:
the Kolai Maṟuttal, by Cāntaliṅka Tēcikar. 22 stanzas. See Zvelebil (1995, p. 119).
the Ñāṉavāciṭṭam by Aḷavantār Māṭavappaṭṭar. 43/44 katais. 2054 stanzas. See Zvelebil (1995, p. 26, s.v. Āḷavantar Mātavapaṭṭar). See Peres (2021): The Ñāna-vāciṭṭam is an unstudied seventeenth-century Tamil translation of the Laghu-yoga-vāsiṣṭha, itself an abridged version of the Sanskrit masterpiece Mokṣopāya.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (November 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Truncated. 380 x 35 mm.
55 folios = Kolaimaṟuttal: Text & Commentary interspersed. Tamil foliation 1-55. f55v blank and more worn out = original outside page. 390 x 35 mm.
247 folios = Ñāṉavāciṭṭam: Text. Tamil foliation 1-247. 390 x 35 mm.
1 folio = Ñāṉavāciṭṭam: Table of Contents. No foliation. 385 x 40 mm.

supportDesc.condition: Fairly good state of preservation, despite many boreholes.

additions.desc: Marginal pratīkas, on recto and verso.
Verse numbering, restarted at the beginning of each chapter (katai).
List of chapters of the Ñāṉavāciṭṭam (entitled katai Aṭṭavaṇai; 4 + 1 columns): chapter's name followed by its folio number; final total chapters (katai). See details below.

binding.p: Original wood covers. No shelfmark. Traces of vibhūti on the outside faces (front cover, recto; back cover; verso). 390 x 35 mm.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year maṉmatha of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1835-1836, 1775-1776, 1715-1716, etc. See colophon (U3, f247r2). Dated to circa 1780 by Vinson (1868), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 16, no. 83.
Peres, Ofer. 2021. Barefaced Lies on the Path to the Truth: The “Tale of the Little Boy” in the Ñāṉa-vāciṭṭam. In: Journal of South Asian Intellectual History 4, pp. 72-94. Paris: Maisonneuve.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — See p. 24, no. 83.
Zvelebil, Kamil V. 1995. Lexicon of Tamil Literature. Leiden [etc.]: Brill.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
